byline.contributor: Campbell Robertson reported from Baton Rouge, and Alan Blinder from Atlanta.
byline.original: By CAMPBELL ROBERTSON and ALAN BLINDER

abstract: Volunteers and others helping thousands of flood victims in southern Louisiana share both big and small lessons in disaster recovery operations taken from their experiences with Hurricane Katrina; at least 60,600 homes were damaged or ruined in flooding, many in Baton Rouge area.
lead_paragraph: Louisianans hardened by the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina have passed along to new flood victims information ranging from finding temporary shelter to handling drywall.
snippet: Louisianans hardened by the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina have passed along to new flood victims information ranging from finding temporary shelter to handling drywall....

headline.main: After Baton Rouge Flooding, Learning Lessons From New Orleans
headline.print_headline: A Grim Expertise Is Shared in Baton Rouge
